subject: Sales
title: The Nibble
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Nibble.

hook.text: The deal is done. Handshakes ready. Then: 'One more tiny thing â€” can you add free shipping?'

buildup.text: The nibble works because people hate losing a done deal over a small request.

discovery.text: It exploits the sunk cost fallacy. After investing hours, nobody walks over a minor add-on.

twist.text: Nibbles compound. Five small requests can quietly shift a deal's total value by 10% or more.

climax.text: Protect yourself by locking scope upfront. Ask early: 'Is this everything on your wish list?'

punchline.text: The biggest costs hide in the smallest asks.

quiz.question: Why does the 'nibble' tactic work?
options: Small requests seem reasonable after a big agreement
